meanings.definition: The force exerted by wind on a structure or object.
meanings.sent1: During the storm, the windload on the house caused the windows to rattle.
meanings.sent2: Engineers need to consider the windload when designing tall buildings.
meanings.sent3: The windload decided to play a game of tug-of-war with the flag on the rooftop.
meanings.sent4: The windload pushed against the walls of the barn like an invisible giant hand.
meanings.sent5: The windload howled and pushed, trying to test the strength of the structure.

meanings.definition: To calculate or measure the force of wind on a structure or object.
meanings.sent1: The engineers will windload the bridge to ensure it can withstand strong gusts.
meanings.sent2: It is important to windload the tower before construction to prevent any structural issues.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat tried to windload the strength of the wind by sticking its head out the window.
meanings.sent4: She had to windload the impact of the storm before deciding to secure the loose objects.
meanings.sent5: The meteorologist windloaded the potential damage of the hurricane on the coastal town.
